 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (AbsListWidget)

Detailed Description

This is an abstract class for List/Grid ui components.

AbsListWidget is a View in MVC architecture. All classes derived from AbsListWidget present data in specific display structure such as Grid or List. IListItemProvider provide data for AbsListView via IListItemProvider::createItemWidget and IListItemProvider::getItemWidget

The following is an simple example for AbsListWidget.

We have a string array which will be displayed on AbsListWidget: 

 Vector<String *> *pStrings = new Vector<String>();
 pStrings->append(new String("Mauritania"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mayotte"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mexico"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Moldova"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Mozambique"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Montserrat"));
 pStrings->append(new String("Morocco"));

Before we create AbsListWidget, we need to implement our own ItemProvider, and override getItemWidget and createItemWidget function:

 class MyItemProvider: public ItemProvider {

 Vector<String *> &mpStrings; //member variable to point32_t strings.
 Page *mPage;

 const static int32_t32_t TEXT_INDEX = 1;

 public:
     MyItemProvider(Vector<String> &pStrings, Page *page)
         : mpStrings(pStrings), mPage(page) {
     }

     Widget *createItemWidget(int32_t32_t index) {

         LinearController *controller = new LinearController(mPage);
         TextWidget *text = new TextWidget(mPage);
         text->setId(TEXT_INDEX);
         controller->addWidget(text);
         return controller;
     }

     Widget *getItemWidget(Widget *itemWidget, WidgetController *parent, int32_t32_t index) {
         if (itemWidget != NULL) {
             TextWidget *text = dynamic_cast<TextWidget *> (itemWidget.findWidgetById(TEXT_INDEX));
             if (text != NULL && index < mpStrings->size()) {
                 text->setText(*(mpStrings[index]));
             }
         }
         return itemWidget;
     }
 };

After implement our own provider, we can start to create AbsListWidget and show in Page: 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence *savedInstanceState) { 

     AbsListWidget *pAbsListWidget = new AbsListWidget(this);
     MyItemProvider *pProvider = new MyItemProvider(this, pStrings);
     pAbsListWidget->setItemProvider(pProvider);
 
     LinearController *pController = new LinearController(this);
     pController->addWidget(pAbsListWidget);
     
     Sence *pScene = Scene::SceneFactory(this);
     pSence->attachController(pController);
 }

Definition at line 149 of file AbsListWidget.h.

anonymous enum

Disables the transcript mode.

See also:
setTranscriptMode(int32_t)
Enumerator:
TRANSCRIPT_MODE_DISABLED 
TRANSCRIPT_MODE_NORMAL 

The list will automatically scroll to the bottom when a data set change notification is received and only if the last item is already visible on screen.

See also:
setTranscriptMode(int32_t)
TRANSCRIPT_MODE_ALWAYS_SCROLL 

The list will automatically scroll to the bottom, no matter what items are currently visible.

See also:
setTranscriptMode(int32_t)
TOUCH_MODE_REST 

Indicates that we are not in the middle of a touch gesture.

TOUCH_MODE_DOWN 

Indicates we just received the touch event and we are waiting to see if the it is a tap or a scroll gesture.

TOUCH_MODE_TAP 

Indicates the touch has been recognized as a tap and we are now waiting to see if the touch is a longpress.

TOUCH_MODE_DONE_WAITING 

Indicates we have waited for everything we can wait for, but the user's finger is still down.

TOUCH_MODE_SCROLL 

Indicates the touch gesture is a scroll.

TOUCH_MODE_FLING 

Indicates the view is in the process of being flung.

LAYOUT_NORMAL 

Regular layout - usually an unsolicited layout from the view system.

LAYOUT_FORCE_TOP 

Show the first item.

LAYOUT_SET_SELECTION 

Force the selected item to be on somewhere on the screen.

LAYOUT_FORCE_BOTTOM 

Show the last item.

LAYOUT_SPECIFIC 

Make a mSelectedItem appear in a specific location and build the rest of the views from there.

The top is specified by mSpecificTop.

LAYOUT_SYNC 

Layout to sync as a result of a data change.

Restore mSyncPosition to have its top at mSpecificTop

LAYOUT_MOVE_SELECTION 

Layout as a result of using the navigation keys.

LAYOUT_FORCE_LEFT 

Show the first item.

LAYOUT_FORCE_RIGHT 

Show the last item.

Move all views (excluding headers and footers) held by this AbsListView into the supplied List.

This includes views displayed on the screen as well as views stored in AbsListView's internal view recycler.

Parameters:
viewsA list into which to put the reclaimed views Clear the text filter.
virtual int32_t gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::computeHorizontalScrollExtent ( ) [protected, virtual]

Compute the horizontal extent of the horizontal scrollbar's thumb within the horizontal range.

This value is used to compute the length of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollRange() and computeHorizontalScrollOffset(). The default extent is the drawing width of this widget.

Returns:
the horizontal extent of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Widget.

virtual int32_t gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::computeHorizontalScrollOffset ( ) [protected, virtual]

Compute the horizontal offset of the horizontal scrollbar's thumb within the horizontal range.

This value is used to compute the position of the thumb within the scrollbar's track. The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollRange() and computeHorizontalScrollExtent(). The default offset is the scroll offset of this widget.

Returns:
the horizontal offset of the scrollbar's thumb

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Widget.

virtual int32_t gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::computeHorizontalScrollRange ( ) [protected, virtual]

Compute the horizontal range that the horizontal scrollbar represents.

The range is expressed in arbitrary units that must be the same as the units used by computeHorizontalScrollExtent() and computeHorizontalScrollOffset(). The default range is the drawing width of this widget.

Returns:
the total horizontal range represented by the horizontal scrollbar

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Widget.

virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::fillGap ( bool  down) [pure virtual]

Fills the gap left open by a touch-scroll.

During a touch scroll, children that remain on screen are shifted and the other ones are discarded. The role of this method is to fill the gap thus created by performing a partial layout in the empty space.

Parameters:
downtrue if the scroll is going down, false if it is going up

Implemented in gaia::ui::GridWidget.

This row will be used as the motion row when scrolling.

Returns:
The position of the first (or only) item in the row closest to y

virtual float gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::getBottomFadingEdgeStrength ( ) [protected, virtual]

Returns the strength, or intensity, of the bottom faded edge.

The strength is a value between 0.0 (no fade) and 1.0 (full fade). The default implementation returns 0.0 or 1.0 but no value in between. Subclasses should override this method to provide a smoother fade transition when scrolling occurs.

Returns:
the intensity of the bottom fade as a float between 0.0f and 1.0f

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Widget.

virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::onAttachedToWindow ( ) [protected, virtual]

This is called when the widget is attached to a window.

At this point it has a Surface and will start drawing. Note that this function is guaranteed to be called before onDraw(const gaia::graphics::Canvas&), however it may be called any time before the first onDraw -- including before or after onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t).

Called when the window containing this widget gains or loses focus.

Note that this is separate from widget focus: to receive key events, both your widget and its window must have focus. If a window is displayed on top of yours that takes input focus, then your own window will lose focus but the widget focus will remain unchanged.

virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::setScrollingCacheEnabled ( bool  enabled) [virtual]

Enables or disables the children's drawing cache during a scroll.

By default, the drawing cache is enabled but this will use more memory.

When the scrolling cache is enabled, the caches are kept after the first scrolling. You can manually clear the cache by calling view.ViewGroup#setChildrenDrawingCacheEnabled(boolean).

Parameters:
enabledtrue to enable the scroll cache, false otherwise
See also:
isScrollingCacheEnabled()
View::setDrawingCacheEnabled(boolean)

virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::setSelector ( gaia::graphics::Drawer *  sel) [virtual]
virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::setSmoothScrollbarEnabled ( bool  enabled) [virtual]

When smooth scrollbar is enabled, the position and size of the scrollbar thumb is computed based on the number of visible pixels in the visible items.

This however assumes that all list items have the same height. If you use a list in which items have different heights, the scrollbar will change appearance as the user scrolls through the list. To avoid this issue, you need to disable this property.

When smooth scrollbar is disabled, the position and size of the scrollbar thumb is based solely on the number of items in the provider and the position of the visible items inside the provider. This provides a stable scrollbar as the user navigates through a list of items with varying heights.

Parameters:
enabledWhether or not to enable smooth scrollbar.
See also:
#setSmoothScrollbarEnabled(boolean) ref R.styleable::AbsListView_smoothScrollbar
virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidget::setStackFromBottom ( bool  stackFromBottom) [virtual]

When stack from bottom is set to true, the list fills its content starting from the bottom of the view.

Parameters:
stackFromBottomtrue to pin the view's content to the bottom edge, false to pin the view's content to the top edge
